main.name: Nordic-Giant Project
main.description: I am a web development engineer and I use react and python to develop pages. This project is a resume template that can be used as the project home page or resume page
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I'm a tinkerer and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over.

education.description: An intensive coding bootcamp (640 hours) that qualifies Full stack developers. Built several projects, all code is available on Github for code review.
Specializes in robotics and automation. Average of 86. Specializing in the field of Robotics and Mechanical design. Member of the college's Robotics club, building project with working with Arduino

work.title: QA System Engineer
work.description: As a QA System, my role was to verify the new versions of the machine program. By reaching endpoints and complex management of the program, I could find bugs in the software and help the software team develop better versions for the products.

skills.name: React Js
skills.description: React was my first framework. It has grown on me though and I will continue to use it going forward. I have built many ReactJS based website and I'm sure that for now, React is my favorite (this personal site based on React).

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. The bulk of my experience with it has been in almost all of my end-2-end projects

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: In the context of MongoDB, for many applications, the ease of use of MongoDB better suits my needs and it is enjoyable to work with

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python was the first programming language that I started using in college. It is a language I am familiar with in terms of data-structure, algorithm programming, and machine learning.

skills.name: Vue
skills.description: Vue was the second framework I started to work with. The learning curve in this framework is amazing and just after a few days, I could build an end-2-end application. For sure, Vue is a wonderful framework to work with.

skills.name: Angular

skills.name: Express
skills.description: As Express writes in their documentation - Fast, opinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js. For a Node developer, Express is a helpful framework.
